p: Flavonoids are secondary metabolites corresponding to polyphenols that have a diverse structure, taking the form glycosides or aglycones in fruits and vegetables such as onions, berries, kale, and green tea [ 60]. Flavonoids have a chemical structure of 15 carbons, with a skeleton of phenyl-benzo-γ-pyran (C6–C3–C6), also known as nucleus flava, composed of two phenyl rings and a heterocyclic (pyran) ring. Flavonoids comprise of flavones, flavonols, flavonoids, flavanones, isoflavones and anthocyanidins [ 61].
